title: Present Perfect Or Present Perfect Continuous

exercises.title: Present Perfect Or Present Perfect Continuous

questions.question: I ...................................... here for two weeks now.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: She .................................. to Dublin. You can't meet here now.
questions.description: Has gone is used to talk about incomplete visits.

questions.question: She ................................. to Ireland so she knows that country.
questions.description: Has been is used to talk about completed visits.

questions.question: We ......................................... in this city for twenty-five years.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: 'You look tired.' 'Yes, I ..................................... for hours.'
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ........................................ a letter from him.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used to talk about recently finished actions and situations.

questions.question: He ..................................... any of the tasks I assigned to him.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used to talk about recently finished actions and situations.

questions.question: I ...................................... reading the letters.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about recently finished actions or situations.

questions.question: He ...................................... for a job for years.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: Have you ever ................................... oysters?
questions.description: The third form of the verb is used after has and have.

questions.question: I .................................. a lot about him.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about finished events when there is no time reference.
